meta.notes: In-universe, unreliable, chaotic reviews for droids, organized by Droid Degree. Flavor-only.

firstDegreeDroids: This medical droid knows too much about me.
Why does it sigh before diagnosing me.
Refused to treat me until I stopped bleeding on the floor.
Explained my condition using words I did not like.
It keeps records. I don't want it to.
Diagnosed me correctly but made me feel worse.
Asked me to rate my pain. Did not accept my answer.
I think it's disappointed in my life choices.
secondDegreeDroids: Fixed the engine. Broke something else.
It welded the wrong thing but insisted it was correct.
Works nonstop and judges anyone who rests.
It solved the problem. The wrong problem.
Won't stop recalibrating things that worked fine.
Asked for tools it already had.
Very good at repairs. Very bad at explaining.
I think it likes the ship more than me.
thirdDegreeDroids: Apologized for things I didn't notice.
It narrates every task like a tragedy.
Corrected a Hutt. That went poorly.
Reminds me of appointments I was avoiding.
Asks permission to clean. Cleans anyway.
It knows too many languages and uses them.
I caught it judging my posture.
fourthDegreeDroids: Asked for permission to use 'maximum force.'
Keeps saying 'target acquired' in casual settings.
I do not trust it near doors.
fifthDegreeDroids: Moved everything except what I asked for.
Dropped a crate and stared at it.
I think it enjoys carrying heavy things too much.
